TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MessageBoxResult extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies which message box button that a user clicks. MessageBoxResult is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.MessageBox.Show%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.MessageBox.Show%2A> returns a MessageBoxResult value that specifies which button on a message box a user clicked. <xref:System.Windows.MessageBoxButton> specifies which buttons are displayed on a message box.
The result value that is returned from a message box depends on what buttons the message box has and how a user closes a message box:
- On a message box that has an **OK** button, F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.OK?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned if a user clicks the **OK** button, clicks the **Close** button in the title bar, or presses the **ESC** key.
- On a message box that has an **OK** button and a **Cancel** button, F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.OK?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned if a user clicks the **OK** button. If a user clicks the **Cancel** button or the **Close** button in the title bar, F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.Cancel?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned.
- On a message box that has a **Yes** button and a **No** button, the **Close** button in the title bar is disabled. Consequently, F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.Yes?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned if a user clicks the **Yes** button, and F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.No?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned if a user clicks the **No** button.
- On a message box that has a **Yes** button, a **No** button, and a **Cancel** button, F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.Yes?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned if the **Yes** button is clicked and F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.No?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned if the **No** button is clicked. If a user clicks the **Cancel** button or the **Close** button in the title bar, F:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.Cancel?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is returned.
## Examples For more information, see [MessageBox Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160023).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxResult Cancel = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The result value of the message box is **Cancel**.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxResult No = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The result value of the message box is **No**.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxResult None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The message box returns no result.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxResult OK = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The result value of the message box is **OK**.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxResult Yes = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The result value of the message box is **Yes**.
